result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie L Joehnk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 2 years.
Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan; be in full compliance before license reinstated.

miscConds.notes:
The Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $1200.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, including $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge by the end of probation period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment. 
Pay all supervision fees. Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge.
Court ordered that all financial obligations be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

Seek/maintain full time employment or full time school with part time employment.
Participate in vocational training.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Obtain Mental Health evaluation and complete any follow-up care/treatment.
Participate in Cognitive Thinking Intervention counseling.

Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment.
No illegal drugs or alcohol with random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With release for employment- good time allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katie L Joehnk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: WCS Status Report, received and filed.

Defendant Katie L Joehnk in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  James W. Frisch appeared for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin. No offer made by the State. Parties are awaiting blood results.  Court ordered Defendant stay in compliance with JusticePoint and continue to follow all terms and conditions of bail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Report received and filed with court.

Defendant Katie L Joehnk in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date; Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Katie L Joehnk in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Brandon Wigley for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Arraignment scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 4/8/15.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Katie L Joehnk in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Defendant Katie L Joehnk in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
